intro: Silene hirsuta var. sabuletorum, commonly known as the hairy catchfly, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive hairy stems and leaves. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Silene hirsuta var. sabuletorum is a herbaceous perennial that is relatively hardy and adaptable to various environmental conditions.
